org.finra.herd.tools.common.databridge

Class DataBridgeApp

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.finra.herd.tools.common.databridge.DataBridgeApp
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DownloaderApp, UploaderApp

    public abstract class DataBridgeApp
extends Object
    A base class for the uploader and downloader applications. This class is abstract since it is not an actual application that has a main method, but rather provides common base functionality that should be used by an extending class.

      • getArgumentParser

        public abstract ArgumentParser getArgumentParser()
        Gets the application argument parser.
        Returns:
        the argument parser.

      • go

        public abstract DataBridgeApp.ReturnValue go(String[] args)
                                      throws Exception
        Runs the application. This is the main entry into the application class itself and is typically called from a main method.
        Parameters:
        args - the command line arguments.
        Returns:
        the application return value.
        Throws:
        Exception - if any problems were encountered.

      • parseCommandLineArguments

        protected DataBridgeApp.ReturnValue parseCommandLineArguments(String[] args,
                                                              org.springframework.context.ApplicationContext applicationContext)
        Parses the command line arguments using the specified argument parser. Common data bridge options will be initialized and added to the argument parser in this method, but any application specific arguments should be added to the argument parser prior to calling this method. Ensure the argParser was set in this class prior to calling this method.
        Parameters:
        args - the command line arguments.
        applicationContext - the Spring application context.
        Returns:
        the return value if the application should exit or null if the application can continue.

      • createApplicationContext

        protected org.springframework.context.ApplicationContext createApplicationContext()
        Creates and returns the Spring application context.
        Returns:
        the application context
